entries.label: AWS Athena
entries.description: AWS Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL.

entries.label: AWS EMR
entries.description: Amazon EMR is a cloud big data platform for running large-scale distributed data processing jobs, interactive SQL queries, and machine learning applications.

entries.label: AWS Glue
entries.description: AWS Glue is a fully managed extract, transform, and load (ETL) service that makes it easy to prepare and load data for analytics.

entries.label: AWS Lake Formation
entries.description: AWS Lake Formation is a service that makes it easy to set up a secure data lake in days.

entries.label: Airflow
entries.description: Apache Airflow is a platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows.

entries.label: Databricks
entries.description: Databricks is a unified data analytics platform designed to help data teams solve the world's toughest problems.

entries.label: Flink
entries.description: Apache Flink is a framework and distributed processing engine for stateful computations over unbounded and bounded data streams.

entries.label: Google BigQuery
entries.description: Google BigQuery is a fully-managed, serverless data warehouse that enables scalable analysis over petabytes of data.

entries.label: Presto
entries.description: Presto is an open source distributed SQL query engine for running interactive analytic queries against data sources of all sizes.

entries.label: Spark
entries.description: Apache Spark is a unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing.

entries.label: Streamlit
entries.description: Streamlit is an open-source app framework for Machine Learning and Data Science teams to create beautiful, performant apps quickly.

entries.label: dbt
entries.description: dbt (data build tool) enables analytics engineers to transform data in their warehouses by simply writing select statements.

entries.label: AWS DynamoDB
entries.description: Amazon DynamoDB is a key-value and document database that delivers single-digit millisecond performance at any scale.

entries.label: AWS S3
entries.description: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an object storage service offering industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance.

entries.label: Amazon ElastiCache
entries.description: Amazon ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory caching service supporting flexible, real-time use cases.

entries.label: Amazon MemoryDB
entries.description: Amazon MemoryDB for Redis is a Redis-compatible, durable, in-memory database service that delivers ultra-fast performance.

entries.label: Amazon Redshift
entries.description: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service in the cloud.

entries.label: Amazon Feature Store
entries.description: Amazon Feature Store is a fully managed feature store for machine learning.

entries.label: Apache Cassandra
entries.description: Apache Cassandra is a free and open-source, distributed, wide-column store, NoSQL database management system.

entries.label: Consul
entries.description: Consul is a service mesh solution providing a full featured control plane with service discovery, configuration, and segmentation functionality.

entries.label: Druid
entries.description: Apache Druid is a high performance real-time analytics database.

entries.label: Elasticsearch
entries.description: Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of addressing a growing number of use cases.

entries.label: Exasol
entries.description: Exasol is an in-memory, column-oriented, relational database management system.

entries.label: HBase
entries.description: Apache HBase is an open-source, distributed, versioned, non-relational database modeled after Google's Bigtable.

entries.label: HDFS
entries.description: Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) is a distributed file system designed to run on commodity hardware.

entries.label: Hazelcast
entries.description: Hazelcast is an open source in-memory data grid based on Java.

entries.label: Memcached
entries.description: Memcached is a high-performance, distributed memory object caching system.

entries.label: MongoDB
entries.description: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program.

entries.label: MySQL
entries.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

entries.label: Oracle DB
entries.description: Oracle Database is a multi-model database management system produced and marketed by Oracle Corporation.

entries.label: PostgreSQL
entries.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development.

entries.label: Redis
entries.description: Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker.

entries.label: RocksDB
entries.description: RocksDB is an embeddable persistent key-value store for fast storage.

entries.label: Solr
entries.description: Apache Solr is an open-source enterprise-search platform, written in Java.

entries.label: Valkey
entries.description: Valkey is a highly available key-value store for the edge.

entries.label: AWS CloudFormation
entries.description: AWS CloudFormation provides a common language to describe and provision all the infrastructure resources in your cloud environment.

entries.label: AWS CloudFront
entries.description: Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally.

entries.label: AWS Elemental MediaConvert
entries.description: AWS Elemental MediaConvert is a file-based video transcoding service with broadcast-grade features.

entries.label: AWS Lambda
entries.description: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.

entries.label: AWS Service Catalog
entries.description: AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS.

entries.label: AWS Step Functions
entries.description: AWS Step Functions is a serverless function orchestrator that makes it easy to sequence AWS Lambda functions and multiple AWS services into business-critical applications.

entries.label: Amazon Bedrock
entries.description: Amazon Bedrock is a fully managed service that makes foundation models from leading AI companies accessible via an API.

entries.label: Amazon Pinpoint
entries.description: Amazon Pinpoint is a flexible and scalable outbound and inbound marketing communications service.

entries.label: Amazon SageMaker
entries.description: Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning platform that enables developers and data scientists to build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly.

entries.label: Docker
entries.description: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

entries.label: GraalVM
entries.description: GraalVM is a high-performance JDK distribution designed to accelerate the execution of applications written in Java and other JVM languages.

entries.label: Kotlin Multiplatform
entries.description: Kotlin Multiplatform is a cross-platform development solution that allows you to share code between multiple platforms.

entries.label: Kubernetes
entries.description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

entries.label: Open Policy Agent
entries.description: Open Policy Agent (OPA) is an open source, general-purpose policy engine that unifies policy enforcement across the stack.

entries.label: OpenTelemetry
entries.description: OpenTelemetry is a collection of tools, APIs, and SDKs used to instrument, generate, collect, and export telemetry data for analysis.

entries.label: Skipper
entries.description: Skipper is an HTTP router and reverse proxy for service composition, designed to handle large amounts of dynamically configured HTTP route definitions.

entries.label: Slurm
entries.description: Slurm is an open source, fault-tolerant, and highly scalable cluster management and job scheduling system for large and small Linux clusters.

entries.label: WebAssembly
entries.description: WebAssembly (Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine, designed as a portable target for high-performance applications on the web.

entries.label: ZMON
entries.description: ZMON is Zalando's open-source platform monitoring tool, allowing definition and scheduling of alerts across teams.

entries.label: Clojure
entries.description: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose programming language, combining the approachability of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.

entries.label: Dart
entries.description: Dart is a client-optimized language for fast apps on any platform, used for developing mobile, desktop, server, and web applications.

entries.label: Go
entries.description: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

entries.label: GraphQL
entries.description: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries with your existing data.

entries.label: Haskell
entries.description: Haskell is a statically typed, purely functional programming language with type inference and lazy evaluation.

entries.label: Java
entries.description: Java is a class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

entries.label: JavaScript
entries.description: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.

entries.label: Kotlin
entries.description: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference.

entries.label: OpenAPI (Swagger)
entries.description: OpenAPI Specification (formerly Swagger Specification) is an API description format for REST APIs.

entries.label: Python
entries.description: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language, emphasizing code readability and simplicity.

entries.label: R
entries.description: R is a programming language and free software environment for statistical computing and graphics supported by the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.

entries.label: Rust
entries.description: Rust is a multi-paradigm programming language designed for performance and safety, especially safe concurrency.

entries.label: Scala
entries.description: Scala is a strong statically typed general-purpose programming language which supports both object-oriented programming and functional programming.

entries.label: Swift
entries.description: Swift is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple Inc. for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, Linux, and z/OS.

entries.label: TypeScript
entries.description: TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript, adding optional static typing, classes, and modules.

entries.label: AWS Kinesis
entries.description: Amazon Kinesis is a platform for streaming data on AWS, offering powerful services to make it easy to load and analyze streaming data, and also providing the ability to build custom streaming data applications.

entries.label: AWS SNS
entries.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) is a fully managed messaging service for both application-to-application (A2A) and application-to-person (A2P) communication.

entries.label: AWS SQS
entries.description: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.

entries.label: Kafka
entries.description: Apache Kafka is an open-source distributed event streaming platform used by thousands of companies for high-performance data pipelines, streaming analytics, data integration, and mission-critical applications.

entries.label: Nakadi
entries.description: Nakadi is a distributed event bus that implements a RESTful API abstraction on top of Kafka-like queues.

entries.label: RabbitMQ
entries.description: RabbitMQ is an open source message broker software that originally implemented the Advanced Message Queuing Protocol and has since been extended with a plug-in architecture to support other protocols.
